FROM: Richard B. Hull
Various letters and memoranda addressed to me from you during the period
June 1 to the present In re the Lester Nelson letter of May 21, 1958,
turning down the large scale NAEB request and the question, WHERE 00 WE
GO FROM HERE?
Present and Past Tense
1. All of us share the sense of shock voiced by Chadeayne in his June 2nd letter.
Certainly the NAEB delegates waiting upon Nelson would have laid $0-40 odds
for a favorable Fund or Foundation response to the big proposal following our
meeting.
A copy of Paulu*s letter of June 3, summarizing the notes taken at the May 21
meeting with Nelson illustrates the basis for our optimism and also the record
of literal fact on which Nelson technically premised his May 28 letter.
2. A telephone conversation with Nelson prior to my drafting of my June 6 letter
appealing for a short-time grant (all of you now have copies) led me to beiieve
quite definitely that Nelson wrote this letter under official Instructions from
above. This is m^ conclusion and not a paraphrase or quotation of remarks by
Nelson.
3. One can only speculate as to what prompted such a decision In the Ford hierarchy.
At this point, speculation without some solid data is probably useless. Whether
or not the upcoming meeting of The Fund for the Advancement of Education board
June 20 or 21 will provide illumination remains to be seen. However for the
feSSi Ip. 9l speculations see copy of Skornia*s letter to Chadeayne of June 3,
e.g., items 4 and 6. A point of fact on Skornia's item I re Foundation and
Fund: Nelson is now officially the Treasurer of the Fund and a member of the
Education Division of the Foundation. Ergo he does speak for both and told me
so. However WHO speaks TO him remains the question.
NOTE: For further speculation and indictment read the chapter on foundations
in Whyte*s “The Organization Man.“
4. Warm thanks to Schooley and Skornia for the short-term “interim budget* detail
they prepared.
